Tolkien-related events that took place in 1928.

content.title: January
content.content:
12 - A New Glossary of the Dialect of the Huddersfield District, containing a Foreword by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien reads a paper, The Chill Barbarians of the North, at a meeting of the Newman Society, in Oxford.

content.title: February
content.content: 9 - Frank Frazetta, who would create illustrations for The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings is born.

content.title: March
content.content: 27-28 - Tolkien works on the latter part of Canto IV of Lay of Leithian.

content.title: April
content.content: 7 - The Tablet reports about J.R.R. Tolkien's paper "The Chill Barbarians of the North".

content.title: June
content.content: 6 - J.R.R. Tolkien is invited to a dinner marking the completion of the Oxford English Dictionary.

content.title: July
content.content: 22 - Orson Bean, who would voice Bilbo Baggins in The Hobbit (1977 film) and Frodo Baggins (as well as Bilbo) in The Return of the King, is born.

content.title: September
content.content: 17 - Roddy McDowall, who would voice Samwise Gamgee in The Return of the King (1980 film), is born.

content.title: December
content.content:
20 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.
25 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.
29 - Bernard Cribbins, who would narrate several episodes of Jackanory's telling of The Hobbit, is born.

? - Tolkien assists Sir Mortimer Wheeler in the unearthing of a Roman Asclepieion at Lydney Park, Gloucestershire.
? - Tolkien draws "Owlamoo".
